description: In today’s rapidly changing global business environment, business researchers and managers need to be aware of emerging trends and issues and develop an understanding of how these trends may impact theories and practice. This course provides students opportunity to examine a number of contemporary business/management issues. The course will enable students to consider the complexity of these developing trends, explore related research literature, and hence increase comprehensive understanding on business research.

syllabus.en:
 Introduction: Identify contemporary issues in business research.
 Contemporary issue I: Organizational Behavior and Theory
 Contemporary issue II: Marketing and Logistics
 Contemporary issue III: E-business and IT Application
 Contemporary issue IV: Finance and Accounting
 Contemporary issue V: Industrial Management
 Contemporary issue VI: Entrepreneurship and R&D

teachingAndAssessment.objective: Identify contemporary issues in business research.
Distinguish between various business majors and understand their respective major concerns.
Identify the value of conducting research on current topics in business.
